[i](As a Siege enters, choose an opponent to protect it. You and others can attack it. When it’s defeated, exile it, then cast it transformed.)[/i]
When this battle enters, creatre three 1/1 red Soldier creature tokens with break. Creatures you control gain haste until end of turn. [i](Whenever a creature with break deals combat damage to a player, you get a break counter.)[/i]
rules_text2:
First strike, protection from artifact creatures [i](This permanent can’t be targeted or dealt damage by artifact creatures.)[/i]
Break [i](When this creature deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on up to one other target creature.)[/i]
notes:
2.2.0: A couple of changes for this card, mainly because the break changes make the frontside effect way too good. Now it’s a heck of a finisher, albeit most likely on the turn afterwards when you’ve put a bunch of counters on stuff. Also the backside doesn’t buff your whole board both to save space and because pro artifacts on everything was unbeatable against the wrong decks. Also gave it first strike because why not make it cracked to fight against? That’s Dunban over there.
2.2.1: Put back to 5 mana now that the tokens are 1/1s again. Made the defense 4 so that the tokens can’t flip it the turn of, but you only need two buffed tokens on the next turn to flip it. Also just made Dunban’s protection just work on artifact creatures.
